eg.ui

Class UIComponents

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.ui.UIComponents

  • public class UIComponents
extends java.lang.Object
    Static methods to create UI components with common behaviours, layouts or colors

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static javax.swing.JPanel grayBorderedPanel()
      Creates a JPanel with a line border that has the gray color and weight of one pixel
      static javax.swing.border.MatteBorder grayMatteBorder(int t, int l, int b, int r)
      Creates a MatteBorder with the gray color
      static javax.swing.JPanel labeledPanel(javax.swing.JLabel lb, javax.swing.JButton bt)
      Creates a JPanel that contains the specified JLabel and JButton with a scaled gap in between
      static javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar()
      Creates a JMenuBar that has the bar height and a border with a weight of one pixel in the gray color at the bottom
      static javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane()
      Creates a JScrollPane that has no border and a unit increment set to the value of 15.
      static ExtTabbedPane tabPane()
      Creates an ExtTabbedPane that has the bar height, is scrollable and not focusable
      static javax.swing.border.TitledBorder titledBorder(java.lang.String title)
      Creates a titled border with the light gray color and a title that is displayed in Verdana with the scaled font size based on 8 pt
      static javax.swing.JToolBar toolBar(javax.swing.JButton[] bts, java.lang.String[] tooltips, javax.swing.JButton rightBt)
      Creates a JToolBar that has the bar height and a border in the gray color with a weight of one pixel at the bottom.
      static javax.swing.JButton undecoratedButton()
      Creates a JButton that has no border, is not focusable and has an unfilled content area

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

                                                             int l,

                                                             int r)
        Creates a MatteBorder with the gray color
        Parameters:
        t - the top inset
        l - the left inset
        b - the bottom inset
        r - the right inset
        Returns:

      • titledBorder

        public static javax.swing.border.TitledBorder titledBorder(java.lang.String title)
        Creates a titled border with the light gray color and a title that is displayed in Verdana with the scaled font size based on 8 pt
        Parameters:
        title - the title
        Returns:
        a new titled border

                                              javax.swing.JButton bt)

      • toolBar

        public static javax.swing.JToolBar toolBar(javax.swing.JButton[] bts,
                                           java.lang.String[] tooltips,
                                           javax.swing.JButton rightBt)
        Creates a JToolBar that has the bar height and a border in the gray color with a weight of one pixel at the bottom.

        The toolbar is not opaque and not floatable. The buttons in bts are not focusable.

        Parameters:
        bts - the array of JButtons. Can be null
        tooltips - the array of tooltips for bts. Can be null
        rightBt - the button aligned to the right
        Returns:
        a new JToolBar

      • menuBar

        public static javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar()
        Creates a JMenuBar that has the bar height and a border with a weight of one pixel in the gray color at the bottom
        Returns:
        the JMenuBar

      • undecoratedButton

        public static javax.swing.JButton undecoratedButton()
        Creates a JButton that has no border, is not focusable and has an unfilled content area
        Returns:
        the JButton

      • tabPane

        public static ExtTabbedPane tabPane()
        Creates an ExtTabbedPane that has the bar height, is scrollable and not focusable
        Returns:
        a new ExtTabbedPane

      • scrollPane

        public static javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane()
        Creates a JScrollPane that has no border and a unit increment set to the value of 15. The scrollbars are displayed as as needed
        Returns:
        the JScollPane
